titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: This is a black week for the British Fleet. Two more ships are reported lost, one by torpedoes at the Dardanelles, another by accident at home. I started work upon a sermon for June 10

, when I preach to the 'Churchmen's Union'. Miss Pinkney lunched here. I attended Evensong, & afterwards joined the other Trustees of the Barry Scholarship in their meeting in the Chapter House. The Duke of Northumberland, as Chancellor of the University, presided.
